1.text: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was there a man having his hand dried up.

2.text: And they watched him if he would heal him on the sabbath, that they might accuse him.

3.text: And he says to the man who had his hand dried up, Rise up [and come] into the midst.

4.text: And he says to them, Is it lawful on the sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill? But they were silent.

5.text: And looking round upon them with anger, distressed at the hardening of their heart, he says to the man, Stretch out thy hand. And he stretched [it] out, and his hand was restored.

6.text: And the Pharisees going out straightway with the Herodians took counsel against him, how they might destroy him.

7.text: And Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea; and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,

8.text: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea and beyond the Jordan; and they of around Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, having heard what things he did, came to him.

9.text: And he spoke to his disciples, in order that a little ship should wait upon him on account of the crowd, that they might not press upon him.

10.text: For he healed many, so that they beset him that they might touch him, as many as had plagues.

11.text: And the unclean spirits, when they beheld him, fell down before him, and cried saying, Thou art the Son of God.

12.text: And he rebuked them much, that they might not make him manifest.

13.text: And he goes up into the mountain, and calls whom he himself would, and they went to him.

14.text: And he appointed twelve that they might be with him, and that he might send them to preach,

15.text: and to have power [to heal diseases, and] to cast out demons.

16.text: And he gave to Simon the surname of Peter;

17.text: and James the [son] of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, and he gave them the surname of Boanerges, that is, Sons of thunder;

18.text: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananaean,

19.text: and Judas Iscariote, who also delivered him up. And they come to [the] house.

20.text: And again a crowd comes together, so that they cannot even eat bread.

21.text: And his relatives having heard [of it] went out to lay hold on him, for they said, He is out of his mind.

22.text: And the scribes who had come down from Jerusalem said, He has Beelzebub, and, By the prince of the demons he casts out demons.

23.text: And having called them to [him], he said to them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?

24.text: And if a kingdom has become divided against itself, that kingdom cannot subsist.

25.text: And if a house has become divided against itself, that house cannot subsist.

26.text: And if Satan rise up against himself, and is divided, he cannot subsist, but has an end.

27.text: But no one can, having entered into his house, plunder the goods of the strong [man] unless he first bind the strong [man], and then he will plunder his house.

28.text: Verily I say unto you, that all sins shall be forgiven to the sons of men, and all the injurious speeches [with] which they may speak injuriously;

29.text: but whosoever shall speak injuriously against the Holy Spirit, to eternity has no forgiveness; but lies under the guilt of an everlasting sin;

30.text: because they said, he has an unclean spirit.

31.text: And his brethren and his mother come, and standing without sent to him calling him.

32.text: And a crowd sat around him. And they said to him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren seek thee without.

33.text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother or my brethren?

34.text: And looking around in a circuit at those that were sitting around him, he says, Behold my mother and my brethren:

35.text: for whosoever shall do the will of God, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.
